ygData.subject: Re: Don't Give up hope!
ygData.msgSnippet: ... It does kind of suck though that we re the ones continually paying for other people s mistakes.  Sometimes I wish we had check-boxes next to each party
ygData.messageBody:
On Fri, 29 Oct 1999 flash@... wrote:
>
> Operaman,
>
> I have and go through this EXACT same thing!
>
> To be honest? I have given up on trying to teach people until now
>
> The groups I am in at 26 are MUCH better at listening to new tactics
> since as you get more levels, the 'run to mommy' spots greatly reduce

It does kind of suck though that we're the ones continually
paying for other people's mistakes. Sometimes I wish we had
check-boxes next to each party member's names, and I could
just exclude one person (or two or more) from my song effects.

When you group with casters, mention every now and then that
you get a mana regeneration song at level 32. They tend to
take much more interest in keeping you happy and listening to
your requests once they know that. :-)

Tanks tend to be more stubborn, especially rangers and
paladins (the ones who are least dependent on others). One of
the pallies I constantly group with still has this annoying
habit of jumping into fights when I've invised everyone from a
train.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
